title: Talon losing his silence was good.  Please, hear me out before mass-downvoting.
body:
I'm going to have to put myself at risk of mass-downvoting here:

--------------------------------------------

**The fact that he currently is one of the few assassins that 1) ACTUALLY HAS TO COMMIT, and 2) Actually takes strategic thought, are the things he should maintain.**  That's how I feel.
**I like Talon's assassination kit because it's very high-risk/high-reward.**  I.E. he has to try to commit to a kill.  Unlike Zed who warps out regardless.

*However* - the fact that his kit is pretty much **point at the enemy and hit every key** is definitely not healthy.  You appear on them.  They explode.  Or they don't explode, and you probably die.

**So the skill is in his decision-making.**  Can I assassinate that person?  Is it worth the risk of diving in?  Will I be able to escape with my ulti if I mess up?

http://images6.fanpop.com/image/photos/36200000/League-of-legends-image-league-of-legends-36287397-630-446.jpg

But the issue lies in his mechanical skillcap.

Mechanically, he seems Garen-tier.  **Appear on enemy, press everything, hope they die.**  See the issue?
I'm glad he has the strategic skillcap, but I really, *honestly* don't think an assassin that is this mechanically easy should be stronger than he is right now.  
Take someone like him whose skillcap is all in his strategy, make them stronger, and what do you get?  His skillcap would become significantly lower.  *"Can I blow them up?  Definitely.  Can they retaliate?  Obviously not.  Will I die?  Lol, no."*  


Also, arguing that someone deserves buffs because they lose to broken champions is kind of redundant.  Talon is finally balanced - why bring him to the broken champions' levels?  Just bring the broken champions down so he can contend again.

Most people are asking for insignificant buffs, not game-breaking ones. Like the majority of the players would agree that instead of a slow on his e he should have a different utility. Like interrupting channels or a micro-silence. I've seen maybe one thread on here that suggests we give him zed-like abilities, most are just asking for riot to retain some of his old game-play mechanics, such as preventing casters from destroying their team. 

Also, having the silence on cutthroat did add decisional/mechanical depth to his game-play, because some targets are more inhibited by being silenced than others. For example: i would much rather silence a xerath or syndra channeling damage from the back line than a tryndamere or caitlynn who just auto attack away and wreck my team. Riot's the ones who removed this depth from talon's game-play thereby molding him into a jump on the squishiest target and unload champ.

You shouldn't lose sight of the fact that riot literally removed his niche as an anti-mage. Now his chances of being viable in competitive play have completely been thrown out the window and they know it. The truth is that they really don't care and that's what is pissing most people off. Champs like lucian or lee sin or zed are nerfed very cautiously, whereas talon was the same champ for 4 years, then all of the sudden: hey he can't silence anymore because its super unhealthy for the game. They didn't ask for any sort of feedback, didn't give adequate compensation buffs, and then said they would look over how the changes were received, which was overwhelmingly negative, but they just left it at that and haven't said a word in the last 4 months. It's just a slap in the face for the people who play this champ, me included. Of course, I'm not gonna stop playing him, but I'll be damned if I don't try my best to see that this champ receives equal treatment just like the rest of the champs in this game.

I don't think anyone really thinks his silence was healthy. 

People are just mad that he was so highly balanced around it. But didn't get much back when they removed it. 
More damage is an obvious no-no. He has enough. 

This put him in a place where he may be high risk/high reward. But there are champions who can do that too will less risk and sometimes even higher reward. 

Leblanc can burst a target down just as fast and have an escape. Only upside to picking Talon over her is that he has a lot more AoE. 
IMO he just needs a reward for a successful kill. 

Change his passive to "Killing an enemy champion grants Talon invisibility for 0.5 seconds and his next basic attack within 3 seconds applies his current rank of Cutthroat.".

This gives him a reward for killing his target as well as a damage boost to his next target.

While I agree with the fact that he needs something more, I disagree on the proposed change. Talon is my main assassin because I love that he is a proper assassin, *he takes down one high priority target*.

To be a healthy assassin, you should have roughly 3 things:
1. No reliable escape.
2. You should unload on one target and get out, not turn into a f***ing serial killer (I'm looking at you {{champion:55}})
3. You should put yourself at a huge risk for a huge reward.

That said, I don't think many assassins in the game are currently healthy, I think some could use nerfs {{champion:238}} and some could use buffs  {{champion:91}}.

And I call Kat an assassin because she gets a lot of benefit from bursting one person down. Also, you know, she's listed as an assassin.

To be perfectly fair...almost every champion in this game is at or near Garen-tier in terms of complexity. I've played almost every champion over the years and the ones I haven't I've at least looked over their kits and seen them played on video, and there are maybe 4-5 champs I would consider somewhat tricky. Talon's W is a cone skillshot which actually puts him ahead of some others since he at least has some choices to make and can miss his poke before he dives. 

If Riot had a design reason to remove Talon's silence - fine. 

Not giving adequate compensation buffs for a champion that was already "meh" tier is not okay though.

Talon actually requires a bit more skill than you would think in high elo...

Do you save your ult for escape? Do you use it to ambush? Pre-dash or after I dash in?

Does my target have a dash? Could he juke my rake by dashing?

The only thing I think Talon deserves and NEEDS to have is that his dash interrupts channels. It could keep its name, and it would also make his job alot easier.

An idea for a two part E (based off something I read a while ago but changed):  Talon throws a teeny tiny knife.  The knife collides with anything.  Minions, champs, and jungle mobs.  Now, for X amount of time (i.e. 5 seconds) Talon can use his regular E to jump to any target, point and click like always, the slow like it is now.  However, if he jumps to the target he hit with the knife, he will also silence them for the old duration.

EDIT with some reasons why I like the idea:
--------------------
* If he wants the silence, it's a skillshot so counterplay is involved.
* He cannot use his blink until his knife hits something or just disappears.
* That delay both A) tells people he's about to jump and B) breaks his stealth before he actually jumps, although maybe the Ult blades should wait until he actually attacks or reactivates E before they shoot to him, so that he still does the same Ult damage
* He can play mindgames by knifing the Malz, then blinking on Cait, trading the silence for unpredictability
* One of his quotes says "Oh, I lost another blade.  Wonder who it's in this time."  This would finally have him remove a blade from his person and *not* have it come right back, so the quote works

This is actually a pretty good idea, although "make it a skillshot" seems to be the boards general reaction to any low counterplay point and click ability.

However, current Talon already does pretty well against most mages in lane, and this is inarguably a buff because Talon wouldn't actually lose anything compared to his current iteration for missing the skillshot. I feel like if it worked this way most talons would just do what they do now - blink on their target and kill them regardless of whether they hit the skillshot or not. 

I think a good way to do it would to remove the damage from the bleed portion of Q, and add it so that he instead instantly procs that damage if he E's on a target that he hit with the skillshot bit. The fact that the damage is now instantaneous means that you could nerf the damage a bit to keep it in line, or maybe you could just make it so E'ing on targets hit with the skillshot just causes the bleed instead. I don't really think having a bleed makes sense gameplay wise (assassins are about delivering instantaneous damage, not DoTs), but meh.
I like it!
I like how this adds counterplay while ALSO giving the ability strategic depth. The usual "make it a skillshot" argument that gets used for every "OP" targeted ability is getting quite boring.
Yeah, this has been turning around in my head for a while, you have no idea how happy I was to hear that someone thought it was a good idea.  And someone with a gentleman poro skin, no less.

Yeah, tbh, Talon is even lower skullcap than master Yi, because Master Yi at least has to think about dodging abilities and reducing damage, where Talon is just go in, lay down damage, and walk away or be dead.

Ahh, you dont understand the difference between a skillcap and a skill floor.

Master Yi as a VERY HIGH skill cap, although, a very low skill floor. This means that anyone can pick him up and do good, HOWEVER, the amount of things you can do based on how skilled you become with him is VERY high.

This means he is very strong at face value, but is much more effective when used to full potential.

This is different than Garen, who you can play a single game as and be the best you can be with him. If you have mastered the game, you have mastered Garen. However, I would argue Garen's skillcap goes up after he leaves lane. Laning with Garen is braindead simple. After laning however, you can pull off some pretty cool shit.

Honestly, the lowest skill-floor champion, with the lowest skill cap, is probably Taric. The most outrageous thing you are going to do with him is flash E.

Saying Talon requires no skill, is well, foolish.

He has a moderately high skill floor, and a decent skill cap.

I hope this clears that up for you. People tend to downvote without explaining why.

The problem with Talon is that he's rather binary. If he can kill them, then he'll go in and do just that. If he can't 100-0, then if he does go in, he'll get obliterated. There's some room for outplay, but it's almost entirely tied to using his E to dodge a critical source of damage. 

As you stated, once he goes in, he's boring. All of his interesting gameplay happens before he actually touches the opponent. Once he does, the fight is essentially a foregone conclusion, and either Talon will successfully kill his target, or they'll live and likely kill him in return.

Nice post.

I think the only problem I see is that if the skill is called cutthroat and you cut their throats, like the icon shows, one would imagine they can't talk (silence). That's it. I think the silence removal was pretty necessary. Champions that give you 0 ability to fight back are generally on the chopping block when it  comes to nerfs, and Talon was one of them. A level 6 Talon could 100-0 you and by the time you got the opportunity to use your skills again you'd already be at a massive disadvantage, if not dead. The slow at least lets you react.

Talon problem is that his lane is bad. He isn't viable counterpick for any mid at the moment (maybe khartus and veigar but there are plenty champions good against them). Even less popular champions like Jayce, Malz, Vlad!, Kennen Diana or lissandra will outmatch him most of the time. 

Balanced champion should in my opinion have strong and weak matchups. He should fill certain role and be good at it.

Look at Rengar, he is balanced champion with interesting design (after nerfs and bugfixes), more build paths, deeper gameplay (more than 1 sad combo from Talon), and he can jungle with is perfect for assassin with stealth. Both Talon and Rengar are doing  pretty much same thing yet one of them was nerfed harder because his kit was way to straightforward.

Yes, you can have fun with him, yes you can win games and do well. But against good opponents with strong champions you will feel less useful. And no,Riot won't nerf 10 champions just to make Talon decent.
